Find the solution of the following linear system:
$$\begin{cases}
&x &+ &y &+ &z &= &0 \\
&-x &+ &3y &+ &2z &= &-1 \\
&2x &+ &y &- &z &= &0
\end{cases}$$
answer3: The system has infinitely many solutions depending on one parameter.
answer4: The system has infinitely many solutions depending on two parameters.

question: Indicate the coordinate vector of $w=(2,-3)$ relative to the basis $S=\left\{(2,-2), (0,3)\right\}$ of $\mathbb{R}^2$.

The eigenvalues of the matrix $A$ are $\{1, 3\}$. 

Which of the following sets contains the eigenvalues of $A^{-1}$?
Indicate which of the following applications is not linear.

Find the solutions of the following linear system depending on the values of the parameters $a,b\in\mathbb{R}$:
$$\begin{cases}
ax & + & y & = & 1 \\ 
bx & + & y & = & 2 \\ 
\end{cases}$$
answer1:
If $b=a$, the system has no solution. 

If $b\neq a$, the system has $\left(\frac{1}{b-a},\,\frac{b-2a}{b-a}\right)$ as its unique solution
answer2: The system has no solutions for every $a,b\in\mathbb{R}$.
answer3:
The system has no solutions if $a,b\neq 1$. 

If $a=b=1$, the system has $\left(x,\,\frac{x}{2}\right)$ as solution for every $x\in\mathbb{R}$.
answer4: For every $a,b\in\mathbb{R}$, the system has $\left(a-b+x,\,\frac{b-a+x}{2}\right)$ as its unique solution.

answer1: If the kernel of a linear transformation $T:\mathbb{R}^3\longrightarrow \mathbb{R}^3$ is $\left\{(0,0,0)\right\}$, then $T$ is an isomorphism.
answer2: If the kernel of a linear transformation $T:\mathbb{R}^3\longrightarrow \mathbb{R}^4$ is $\left\{(0,0,0)\right\}$, then $T$ is an isomorphism.

$$\begin{cases}
z &- &iw &= &1 \\
iz &- &w &= &1
\end{cases}$$
answer1: The system has $\bigg(\frac{1-i}{2},\frac{-1+i}{2}\bigg)$ as unique solution.
answer3: The system has $(z,-iz)$ as solution for every $z\in\mathbb{C}$.
answer4: The system has $\bigg(\frac{1-i}{2},\frac{1+i}{2}\bigg)$ as unique solution.

Consider the following linear programming problem to determine the optimum production schedule concerning three products $x_1$, $x_2$ and $x_3$ to maximize the profit regarding Company XLK Lda. The production of these products requires resources 1 and 2. 

\[\begin{array}{ll}	
\text{Maximize} & Z= 3x_{1}+x_{2}+5x_{3}\\
\text{subject to} & 6x_{1}+3x_{2}+5x_{3}\leq 45 \text{ (Resource 1)}\\
& 3x_{1}+4x_{2}+5x_{3}\leq 30 \text{ (Resource 2)}\\
& x_{i}\geq 0, i=1~to~3\\	
\end{array}
\]	

Let $S_1$ and $S_2$ be the slack variables for the respective constraints. After we apply the simplex method, the final incomplete simplex tableau is:

\[
\begin{array}{l|ccccc|c}
& x_{1} & x_{2} & x_{3} &  S_{1} & S_{2} & \\
\hline
x_{1} & 1 & -1/3  & 0 &  1/3 & -1/3 & 5 \\
x_{3} & 0 & 1  & 1 &  -1/5 & 2/5 & 3 \\
\hline
& &   & &   & & \\
\end{array}
\]	

If a new contraint $2x_{1}+x_{2}+x_{3}\leq 40 $ is included, determine the solution based on the final complete simplex tableau.

Medical researchers analyze how different dosages of a drug affect the duration of relief from allergic symptoms. They want to develop a statistical model to predict the time of relief (in days) based on the dosage of a new drug. Identify the predictor variable and the response variable.
answer1: The predictor variable is a dosage of a new drug; the response variable is the time of relief.
answer2: The predictor variable is the time of relief; the response variable is the dosage of the new drug.
answer3: The predictor variable is the mean of time of relief; the response variable is the mean of dosage of the new drug.
answer4: The predictor variable is the mean of dosage of a new drug; the response variable is the mean of time of relief.

For each $m\in\mathbb{R}$, describe the solutions of the linear system
$$\begin{cases}
3x & + & y & - & z & = & 1 \\
x & - & 2y & - & z & = & m \\
x & + & y & - & z & = & 1
\end{cases}$$
answer1:
For $m=-2$, the linear system has infinitely many solutions, which are of the form $\left(0,\,y,\,y-1\right)$ for every $y\in\mathbb{R}$.
For $m \neq -2$, the linear system has no solutions.
answer2: The linear system has no solution for every $m\in\mathbb{R}$.
answer3:
For $m \in \{-2,\,0\}$, the linear system has infinitely many solutions, which are of the form $\left(0,\,y,\,y-1\right)$ for every $y\in\mathbb{R}$.
For $m=0$, the linear system has a unique solution, which is $\left(0,\,1,\,1\right)$.
For $m \not\in \{-2,\,0\}$, the linear system has no solutions.
answer4: The linear system has a unique solution for each $m\in\mathbb{R}$, which is $\left(0,\,m,\,m-1\right)$.

question:

$$\begin{cases}
2x &+ &y &- &z &= &1 \\ 
x &+ &y &+ &z &= &2 \\ 
x &- &y &- &z &= &0
\end{cases}$$

answer3: The system has $\left(1,0,1\right)$ and $\left(1,0,-1\right)$ as its solutions.
answer4: The system has $\left(x,0,x\right)$ as solution for every $x\in\mathbb{R}$.

Medical researchers analyze how different dosages of a drug affect the duration of relief from allergic symptoms. They want to develop a statistical model to predict the time of relief (in days) based on the dosage of a new drug. Identify the predictor variable and the response variable.
answer1: The predictor variable is a dosage of a new drug; the response variable is the time of relief.
answer2: The predictor variable is the time of relief; the response variable is the dosage of the new drug.
answer3: The predictor variable is the mean of time of relief; the response variable is the mean of dosage of the new drug.
answer4: The predictor variable is the mean of dosage of a new drug; the response variable is the mean of time of relief.

question: Which of the following statements is correct?
answer1: Matrix multiplication is always commutative if both matrices are diagonal matrices
answer2: Matrix multiplication is always commutative if both matrices are symmetric matrices
answer3: Matrix multiplication is not always commutative if one matrix is the identity matrix
answer4: none of the options given are correct

question:
Consider the differentiable function $f:\mathbb{R}^{2}\rightarrow \mathbb{R},$ $%
f(x,y)=e^{ax^{2}+by^{2}}$. It satisfies the equations:
answer1:
$\dfrac{\partial f}{\partial x}\left( x,y\right) =2axf(x,y),
\dfrac{\partial^{2}f}{\partial x^{2}}\left( x,y\right) =\left( 2a+4a^{2}x^{2}\right) f(x,y),%
\dfrac{\partial ^{2}f}{\partial x\partial y}(x,y)=4abxyf(x,y).$
answer2:
$\dfrac{\partial f}{\partial x}\left( x,y\right) =2af(x,y),\dfrac{\partial
^{2}f}{\partial x^{2}}\left( x,y\right) =\left( 2a+4a^{2}x^{2}\right) f(x,y),%
\dfrac{\partial ^{2}f}{\partial x\partial y}(x,y)=4abxyf(x,y).$
answer3:
$\dfrac{\partial f}{\partial x}\left( x,y\right) =2axf(x,y),\dfrac{\partial
^{2}f}{\partial x^{2}}\left( x,y\right) =\left( 2a+4a^{2}x\right) f(x,y),%
\dfrac{\partial ^{2}f}{\partial x\partial y}(x,y)=4abf(x,y).$
answer4:
$\dfrac{\partial f}{\partial x}\left( x,y\right) =2axf(x,y),\dfrac{\partial
^{2}f}{\partial x^{2}}\left( x,y\right) =\left( 2a+4a^{2}x^{2}\right) f(x,y),%
\dfrac{\partial ^{2}f}{\partial x\partial y}(x,y)=4bxyf(x,y).$

question:
Find the solutions of the following linear system:
$$\begin{cases}
2x & + & y & - & 4z & = & 2 \\ 
-x & + & y & + & z & = & 1 \\ 
x & + & 5y & - & 5z & = & -1
\end{cases}$$
answer2: The system has $\left(1,\,0,\,-1\right)$ as its unique solution.
answer3: The system has $\left(\frac{1}{3}+\frac{5}{3}z,\,\frac{4}{3}+\frac{2}{3}z,\,z\right)$ as solution for every $z\in\mathbb{R}$.
answer4: The system has two solutions: $\left(1,\,0,\,-1\right)$ and $\left(0,\,2,\,-1\right)$.

A researcher studies the wind speed in a particular city. A sample of two hundred observations was recorded. The mean speed was calculated to be $10 m/s$ and the median speed was calculated to be $7 m/s$. Which of the following interpretations is correct?
answer1: $50\%$ of the sampled observations had speed that was less than or equal to $7 m/s$.
answer2: The most frequently occurring wind speed in the sample was $7 m/s$.
answer3: $50\%$ of the sampled observations had speed that was equal to $7 m/s$.
answer4: $50\%$ of the sampled observations had speed that was less than or equal to $10 m/s$.

answer2: The system has $\left(1,\,0,\,-1\right)$ as its unique solution.

answer3: $F^{-1}$ is defined by $F^{-1}(x,y)=(3x-2y, -2x+y)$ and is not a symmetric operator.

Find the solutions of the following linear system:
$$\begin{cases}
x & + & y & - & 3z & + & 2t & = & 1 \\
2x & - & y & - & z & + & t & = & 0 \\
x & + & y & + & z & - & t & = & -2
\end{cases}$$
answer1: The solutions of the system are of the form $\bigg(-\frac{2}{3},\frac{1}{4}t-\frac{7}{12},\frac{3}{4}t-\frac{3}{4},t\bigg)$, for all $t\in\mathbb{R}$.
answer3: The system has $\bigg(-\frac{2}{3},-\frac{7}{12},-\frac{3}{4},0\bigg)$ as unique solution.
answer4: The solution of the system is the vector of coordinates $(2,-1,0,0)$.

question: It is possible to compute $A \cdot B $ if
answer1: matrices $A$ and $B$ are both diagonal and have the same number of rows
answer2: $A$ and $B$ are both $n\times m$, $n\neq m$ matrices
answer3: the number of the rows of $A$ is equal to the columns of $B$
answer4: the number of the columns of $A$ is equal to the columns of $B$
